tradition.title: The Tradition
tradition.description: Every year on January 6th, the Three Wise Men bring gifts to children who have been good throughout the year. Following the Star of Bethlehem, they travel on their camels across the world, continuing their ancient tradition of bringing joy to children just as they brought gifts to the baby Jesus.

melchior.name: Melchior
melchior.title: King of Persia
melchior.description: The eldest of the three, known for his wisdom and generosity. He brings gold, symbolizing kingship.

gaspar.name: Gaspar
gaspar.title: King of India
gaspar.description: The youngest wise man, bringing frankincense which represents divinity and spiritual blessings.

balthazar.name: Balthazar
balthazar.title: King of Arabia
balthazar.description: Known for his deep understanding of ancient prophecies, bringing myrrh, a symbol of future destiny.
